intro: Lightfootia robusta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Lightfootia robusta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
